Beg v svet tehnologije
Ne samo mladi, tudi mnogi starejši svoj prosti čas zapolnjujejo z avdiovizualnimi mašili, ki pozornost odvračajo od resničnega življenja.
02 Nov 2019, 15:57 by Natalija Mljač



GETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTOVsakdan mladih je prežet s tehnologijo, zato je zanje vzpostavljanje pristnih medosebnih odnosov izziv. FOTO: Guliver/Getty images



Za mlade je izziv, kako slišati in upoštevati sebe, pravi dr. Nevenka Podgornik. FOTO: Mineja P. Pulec



GETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTOUmik vase, v tišino potrebujemo za predelavo situacij in odnosov. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images



GETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTOMašila odvračajo pozornost od resničnega življenja. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images


Tudi vi opažate, da so ne le otroci, mladostniki in mlajši odrasli priklopljeni na telefone, tablice, računalnike, temveč da je tudi marsikateri v srednjih letih in starejši neločljiv od digitalnih medijev? Poleg tega ima veliko ljudi skoraj vseskozi prižgan televizor ali radio (doma, na delovnem mestu, med vožnjo), marsikdo kar oboje naenkrat, pogosto le za ozadje, da je pač nekaj slišati. V nekaterih družinah celo vsak član gleda svoj televizor! Nekateri teveja ne ugasnejo niti med obiski. Mnogi pešci, kolesarji, vozači, celo tekači in sprehajalci v gozdu so opremljeni s slušalkami. Študentje med učenjem poslušajo razne posnetke (denimo oddaljeno dogajanje v čitalnici), ki naj bi pripomogli h koncentraciji. Nespečneži se poskušajo zazibati v sen s poslušanjem primerne glasbe ali zvočne knjige. Zakaj je tako? Kaj je narobe s tišino? Zakaj mnogi potrebujejo nenehna zvočna in vidna mašila?
Trend bežanja v informacijski svet je prisoten tudi pri starejši generaciji, ki ima izkušnje z vzpostavljanjem odnosov brez pomoči tehnologije.
Ta trend je bolj značilen za mlajše generacije, ki so odraščale v obdobju izrednega razvoja tehnologije in je njihov vsakdan povsem prežet z njo, odgovarja izr. prof. dr. Nevenka Podgornik, psihoterapevtka iz Nove Gorice. »Zato je zanje izziv, pogosto celo ovira, kako vzpostavljati pristne medosebne odnose, pa tudi, kako slišati in upoštevati sebe. Notranji dialog namreč skorajda ni mogoč, če se znotraj situacij ne zaznamo tudi na osebni ravni.«
Potešitev psihičnih potreb


Za mlade je izziv, kako slišati in upoštevati sebe, pravi dr. Nevenka Podgornik. FOTO: Mineja P. Pulec

Prav tako je trend bežanja v informacijski svet prisoten pri starejši generaciji, ki je odraščala drugače in ima številne izkušnje z igro zunaj, življenjem v naravi, z vzpostavljanjem odnosov brez pomoči tehnologije, razmišlja sogovornica. »A ne glede na to številni v svoj prosti čas vnašajo mašila, ki jim odvračajo pozornost od samozavedanja, od tukaj in zdaj, od soočanja s seboj, z drugimi. Tako se nemalokrat zatekajo tudi k igranju računalniških igric, uporabi družabnih omrežji, različnih internetnih vsebin, h gledanju nanizank, resničnostnih šovov, razvedrilnih, informativnih oddaj …, k vsemu, kar prestavlja udobje, mir in lagodje, saj ne zahteva nikakršnega posebnega napora, ni boleče, saj ni soočanja z njihovim realnim življenjem. Ravno nasprotno, trenutno in navidezno pomaga zmanjšati morebitno frustracijo oziroma nezadovoljstvo, zato jim povsem ustreza.« Terapevtka dodaja, da se nekateri počutijo neprijetno ali tesnobno, če so sami oziroma v tišini: »Starejši poskušajo osamljenost ali odtujenost v odnosih, morda celo nesrečnost, ublažiti z radiem in s televizijo, z informacijami, ki jih ne zadevajo neposredno in so zato bolj sprejemljive od realnosti vsakdana.«Umik v tišino Naš čutni sistem je ob številnih dnevnih dražljajih iz okolja, informacijah, osebnih in digitalnih interakcijah, situacijah vsekakor zelo obremenjen, kar vpliva na počutje, zato potrebujemo umik vase, pojasnjuje dr. Nevenka Podgornik. »V tišini lahko učinkovito predelamo za nas pomembne situacije, odnose, prisluhnemo svojim potrebam, pridemo do pomembnih uvidov in sprememb na bolje. Z zapolnjevanjem vsakdana z nepomembnimi mašili se oddaljujemo od sebe in bližnjih, to pa sčasoma privede do praznine in nezadovoljstva.«


Mašila odvračajo pozornost od resničnega življenja. FOTO: Guliver/Getty ImagesGETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTO

V vseh teh primerih gre za poskus potešitve psihičnih potreb, ki jih v določeni meri dejansko lahko učinkovito zadovoljimo, če to ni edini ali prevladujoči način, temveč znamo svoje potrebe tešiti tudi drugače, še učinkoviteje, pojasnjuje dr. Nevenka Podgornik. »Če pa gre za bežanje, zatekanje, omiljenje bolečine oziroma nezadovoljstva, je to dobro ozavestiti in poiskati bolj zadovoljujoče in učinkovite izbire.«

Escape to the world of technology
Not only young people, but many older people also fill their free time with audiovisual distractions that distract from real life.
02 Nov 2019, 14:57 by Natalija Mljač



GETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTOVany of young people are imbued with technology, so it is challenging for them to establish genuine interpersonal relationships. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty images



The challenge for young people is to hear and consider themselves, says Dr. Nevenka Podgornik. PHOTO: P. Pulec Mine



GETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTOUnderstanding yourself, we need silence to process situations and relationships. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images



GETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTMasters are distracting from real life. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images


Do you also notice that not only children, adolescents and young adults are connected to phones, tablets, computers, but many middle-aged and older people are inseparable from digital media? In addition, many people have their TV or radio turned on almost all the time (at home, at work, while driving), many of them both at once, often just for the background that there is something to hear. In some families, even every member watches their TV! Some teweys do not even go off during visits. Many pedestrians, cyclists, riders, even runners and walkers in the woods are equipped with headphones. During their studies, students listen to various recordings (such as distant reading in the reading room) that are intended to help concentrate. The insomniacs are trying to get a dream by listening to suitable music or a sound book. Why is that so? What's wrong with silence? Why do many need constant sound and visual seals?
The trend of escaping into the information world is also present in the older generation who has experience in building relationships without the help of technology.
This trend is more characteristic of the younger generations who grew up in a period of extraordinary development of technology and their daily life is completely imbued with it, replies Assoc. prof. dr. Nevenka Podgornik, a psychotherapist from Nova Gorica. “Therefore, it is challenging for them, often even hindering how to establish genuine interpersonal relationships, as well as how to hear and consider yourself. In fact, internal dialogue is almost impossible if we do not recognize ourselves within situations on a personal level. "
Psychic needs


The challenge for young people is to hear and consider themselves, says Dr. Nevenka Podgornik. PHOTO: P. Pulec Mine

The trend of escaping to the information world is also present in the older generation, who grew up differently and have many experiences with playing outside, living in nature, building relationships without the help of technology, the interviewee thinks. “Nevertheless, many in their spare time introduce greetings that distract them from self-awareness, from here and now, from confronting themselves, with others. They often resort to playing computer games, using social networks, various internet content, watching TV shows, reality shows, entertaining, informative shows ..., everything that moves comfort, peace and ease, since it does not require any special effort. painful as there is no confrontation with their real life. On the contrary, it instantly and seemingly helps to reduce any frustration or dissatisfaction, so it perfectly suits them. "The therapist adds that some feel uncomfortable or anxious when alone or in silence:" Older people try to be lonely or alienated in relationships, maybe even unhappiness, mitigate with radio and television, with information that is not directly relevant to them and therefore more acceptable than reality in the everyday life. ”Retreat into silence Our sensory system is definitely burdened with many daily environmental stimuli, information, personal and digital interactions. , which affects our well-being, so we need a retreat in ourselves, explains dr. Nevenka Podgornik. »In silence, we can effectively process important situations, relationships, listen to our needs, get important insights and change for the better. By filling our daily lives with insignificant greed, we distance ourselves from ourselves and our loved ones, which eventually leads to emptiness and dissatisfaction. "


Ointments distract from real life. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty ImagesGETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTO

In all these cases, it is an attempt to satisfy psychic needs, which to a certain extent can actually be effectively met, if this is not the only or dominant way, but we can also cope with our needs in a different, even more efficient way, explains Dr. Nevenka Podgornik. "However, when it comes to running, swelling, favorite pain or dissatisfaction, it is good to raise awareness and find more satisfying and effective choices."
